verbs.description: splurt (third-person singular simple present splurts, present participle splurting, simple past and past participle splurted)

entries.meaning: (informal, transitive) To spit out violently, as with disgust or surprise.
examples: God splurted out his mouthful of Cinzano Bianco and bellowed uncontrollably, tears streaming down his face.

entries.meaning: (informal, transitive, intransitive) To squirt out in a messy stream.
examples: She splurted ketchup on her hash browns.
